Studium
  • Authors

Studium is the journal of confessional language studies at Martin Luther College.

Studium fosters the study of the confessional languages at Martin Luther College and in Wisconsin Evangelical Lutheran Synod by publishing original, English translations of historic Latin and German resources drawn from the Lutheran tradition in both Europe and the United States.

Recent Publications

Here are the three latest publications from the journal. Click one to read, or check the full list.

by Adolf Hoenecke

A sermonic farewell to St. Matthew’s Lutheran Church in Milwaukee, WI.

So What Actually Is a Lutheran?

by Edward Moldehnke

An articulation of what Lutheranism is and is not.

Read

Baptism and the Means of Salvation

by David Hollaz

Hollaz address the topic of baptism as a conferring means of salvation.
